text: Rudolf (Rudi) Emil KálmánNational Science Foundation – The President's National Medal of Science: Recipient Details: RUDOLF E. KÁLMÁN (; May 19, 1930 – July 2, 2016) was a Hungarian-born American electrical engineer, mathematician, and inventor. He was known for his co-invention and development of the Kalman filter. It was a mathematical algorithm that is widely used in signal processing, control systems, and guidance, navigation and control. For this work, U.S. President Barack Obama awarded Kálmán the National Medal of Science on October 7, 2009. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Hungarian mathematicians Category:American electrical engineers Category:American mathematicians Category:American inventors Category:Scientists from Budapest
